page.title: 06SURRENDEN CERAMICS PROCESS
page.content: At Surrenden Ceramics they don't make tiles but buy them from a firm called Barbies. They design and print the pattern on each tile. One Underground station requires 70,000 tiles which takes about 35 weeks to make. The pattern is transferred on to each tile by silk screening and then goes into the kiln for about 36 hours. The kiln holds 2,000 tiles. Surrenden Ceramics also put special designs on to plates for indivdiual customers requirements. First they have to design a pattern then draw it on tracing paper and make a photographic transfer which is soaked and then placed onto the plate. This is smoothed into position and then the plate is put into the kiln and fired.
